hint.hint_text: A vulnerability that can be accessed/exploited remotely. Perhaps try scanning the system/network?
The system is vulnerable in terms of its nfs
The system is vulnerable to NFS Share Leak
NFS can be mounted to access files
Remember, search for text in the format of flag{SOMETHING}, and submit it for points
A vulnerability that can be accessed/exploited remotely. Perhaps try scanning the system/network?
The system is vulnerable in terms of its nfs
The system is vulnerable to NFS Share Leak
NFS can be mounted to access files
The flag is encoded/hidden somewhere
There is a layer of encoding using a standard encoding method, look for an unusual string of text and try to figure out how it was encoded, and decode it

Convert the decimal (base 10) string into its ASCII value, character by character in sets of 3. Use an ascii table e.g. http://www.asciitable.com OR an online converter e.g. https://www.branah.com/ascii-converter
Remember, search for text in the format of flag{SOMETHING}, and submit it for points

There is a layer of encoding using a standard encoding method, look for an unusual string of text and try to figure out how it was encoded, and decode it
The flag is encoded using a ROT13 Encoder
Alphabet rotation cipher by 13 positions. Decoding tools are available online e.g. http://www.dcode.fr/rot-cipher

Encoded with a rotation cipher based on the ASCII value using a random key. Uses the 94 printable ascii characters.
Decoding tools are available online e.g. http://www.dcode.fr/rot-cipher

Inspect the file's raw hex. Example tools: hexedit/hexeditor. Some data has been appended to the image with a file signature of: \x50\x4b\x03\x04 ("PK..")
Extract the ZIP file's raw hex into a new file. Starting from the signature to the end of file. Unzip the file.
